Source: Other constructions need to be disassembled first.

Save game data incompatible with this version of the mod has been detected. Please start a new campaign or revert the update to continue playing.

Use the "Restart" option in the pause menu or the "Wipe save data" in the admin menu to restart.
Gives access to weapons and ammunitions belonging to the resistance. Items are purchased using supplies.
Translation: Daje dostęp do broni i amunicji należących do oporu. Przedmioty są kupowane przy użyciu materiałów eksploatacyjnych.

Source: Gives access to weapons and ammunitions provided by the allied faction. Items are purchased using supplies.
Translation: Daje dostęp do broni i amunicji dostarczanych przez frakcję sojuszniczą. Przedmioty są kupowane przy użyciu materiałów eksploatacyjnych.

Source: Place it in a good observation spot.
Translation: Umieść go w dobrym miejscu obserwacyjnym.

Source: Gain access to a resistance officer being present on site.
Translation: Zdobądź dostęp do oficera rezystancyjnego obecnego na miejscu.

Source: Gives access to uniforms and other equipment belonging to the resistance. Items are purchased using supplies.
Translation: Daje dostęp do mundurek i innych urządzeń należących do oporu. Przedmioty są kupowane przy użyciu materiałów eksploatacyjnych.

Source: Gives access to uniforms and other equipment provided by the allied faction. Items are purchased using supplies.
Translation: Daje dostęp do mundurek i innych urządzeń dostarczanych przez frakcję sojuszniczą. Przedmioty są kupowane przy użyciu materiałów eksploatacyjnych.

Source: Allows assigning two ground vehicles to prevent them from being lost, and enables retrieving them from far away.
Translation: Umożliwia przypisanie dwóch pojazdów naziemnych, aby zapobiec ich utraty, i umożliwia ich odzyskanie z daleka.

Source: Allows assigning a single ground vehicle to prevent it from being lost, and enables retrieving it from far away.
Translation: Umożliwia przypisanie pojedynczego pojazdu naziemnego, aby zapobiec utracie go, i umożliwia odzyskanie go z daleka.

Source: Service helipad allows to assign a single helicopter and enables helicopter refueling and repairing. Can be constructed only in airbases.
Translation: Service Helipad pozwala przypisać pojedynczy helikopter i umożliwia tankowanie i naprawę helikoptera. Można konstruować tylko w bazach powietrznych.

Source: Helipad allows to assign a single helicopter, which protects it from being lost and enables retrieving it from far away. Basic version without refueling or repairing abilities.
Translation: Helipad pozwala przypisać jeden helikopter, który chroni go przed utratą i umożliwia odzyskanie go z daleka. Wersja podstawowa bez tankowania lub naprawy zdolności.

Source: Provides living space for a few soldiers that can be recruited.
Translation: Zapewnia przestrzeń życiową dla kilku żołnierzy, których można rekrutować.

Source: Medical tent improves injury regeneration and allows to purchase medical goods using supplies.
Translation: Namiot medyczny poprawia regenerację obrażeń i pozwala na zakup towarów medycznych za pomocą materiałów eksploatacyjnych.

Source: Send a message over long distance.
Complete mortar emplacement. Projectiles can be purchased using supplies.
Translation: Całkowite ustawienie zaprawy. Pociski można kupić za pomocą materiałów eksploatacyjnych.

Source: Allows to store 900 supplies. First one can be constructed for free.
Translation: Pozwala na przechowywanie 900 materiałów eksploatacyjnych. Pierwszy można zbudować za darmo.

Source: Due to missing modding features, the single player and local hosting experience is unavailable on console systems. We suggest setting up a private dedicated server or joining a public one.
Translation: Ze względu na brakujące funkcje modowania, wrażenia hostingowe dla jednego gracza i lokalnego hostingu są niedostępne w systemach konsolowych. Sugerujemy założenie prywatnego serwera dedykowanego lub dołączenie do publicznego.

Source:
Restored objects may collide with constructions or vehicles left in place of destroyed objects, causing undesired effects. This is an experimental feature and it is recommended to back up your save.

Once you confirm this action, you have to force save and restart the server for the changes to take effect.

Forced save will perform entire save in a single operation, which may block the server on large maps and with a lot of data. This may cause remote players, including you, to lose connection. This does not affect the save operation itself.
Translation: Wymuszone zapisywanie wykona całe zapis w jednej operacji, która może blokować serwer na dużych mapach i z dużą ilością danych. Może to spowodować, że odległe graczy, w tym ty, utrata połączenia. Nie wpływa to na samą operację zapisu.

Source:
Are you sure to wipe the campaign save data? After proceeding the scenario will automatically restart.

WARNING: THIS OPERATION CANNOT BE REVERTED. YOU WILL LOSE ALL PROGRESS.
Translation:
Czy na pewno wyczyścisz kampanię zapisz dane? Po kontynuowaniu scenariusz automatycznie uruchomi się ponownie.

OSTRZEŻENIE: Tej operacji nie można przywrócić. Stracisz wszelkie postępy.

Source: Used to identify dead bodies found on the battlefield.
Translation: Służy do identyfikacji martwych ciał znalezionych na polu bitwy.

Source: Your clothes are bloodied. Wearing them breaks your disguise and makes you attract enemy attention. You should change your clothes or go for a swim.
Translation: Twoje ubrania są zakrwawione. Noszenie ich przełamuje przebranie i sprawia, że przyciągasz uwagę wroga. Powinieneś zmienić ubrania lub popływać.

Source: Your clothes have been cleaned. Wearing them will not make you suspicious anymore.
Translation: Twoje ubrania zostały oczyszczone. Noszenie ich nie sprawi, że będziesz już podejrzliwy.

Source: You will be treated as a combatant when openly carrying weapons or wearing combatant attire. Watch out, as you may become wanted if enemies see you.
Translation: Będziesz traktowany jako bojownik, gdy otwarcie nosząc broń lub nosząc strój bojowy. Uważaj, jak możesz być poszukiwany, jeśli wrogowie cię zobaczą.

Source: You are now wanted by the enemy. Hide in a safe place and remain out of sight for some time to lose the heat.
Translation: Jesteś teraz poszukiwany przez wroga. Ukryj się w bezpiecznym miejscu i przez pewien czas pozostań poza zasięgiem wzroku, aby stracić ciepło.

Source: Set to 0% to remove wanted status.

Despite best efforts and heroic fight, %1 has failed to liberate %2. %3 forces are here to stay for a long time. Next time pay more attention to population support and logistics of your revolution. No military effort in history succeeded without these elements.
Translation: Pomimo najlepszych wysiłków i heroicznej walki %1 nie uwolniło %2. %3 siły są tutaj, aby pozostać przez długi czas. Następnym razem zwróć większą uwagę na wsparcie ludności i logistykę Twojej rewolucji. Bez tych elementów nie powiodło się żadnego wysiłku wojskowego w historii.

Source: Great job! Thanks to the relentless effort made by %1, the population of %2 will no longer be opressed by %3 forces. These heroic acts will be remembered by many generations to come.
Translation: Świetna robota! Dzięki nieustanne wysiłek podjęty przez %1 populacja %2 nie będzie już oprzeszczana przez %3 sił. Te heroiczne akty zostaną zapamiętane przez wiele pokoleń.

Source: Use this to wake up incapacitated persons. Can be also self administered.
Translation: Użyj tego, aby obudzić obezwładnione osoby. Można również podawać.

Source: One time use injector with a dose of epinephrine.
Translation: Jedno raz użyć wtryskiwacza z dawką epinefryny.

Source:
Different types of armories can be built, depending on the operating base type:
- Allied armory is available at military bases and offers weapons and ammunition of your supporting faction.
- Field armory is available at FOBs and offers weapons and ammunition of the player faction.
Armories allow the purchase of weapons and ammunition using resources stored at the base.
Command post enables you to have a resistance officer on site, allowing you to hand in dogtags, take posters or missions in your operating base, without the need to travel to a hideout.
Equipment stores allow you to purchase uniforms and non-lethal equipment using resources stored at the base.

Different types of stores can be built, depending on the operating base type:
- Allied equipment store is available at military bases and offers equipment of your supporting faction.
- Field equipment store is available at FOBs and offers equipment of the player faction.
To use fast travel, you need to open your map and select the fast travel icon from the tool picker in the upper-left corner of the screen.

Fast travel is available only to player-controlled operating bases. It is more expensive than public transport, but it can be performed from any location, even far away from roads and infrastructure. You cannot fast travel while being wanted, but you don’t have to appear as a civilian.
Helipads offer a single parking spot to which helicopters can be assigned, and otherwise they are identical in functionality to garages.
Additionally to regular helipads, military bases allow to construct a service helipad, which can be used to repair helicopters.

Medical tents offer faster regeneration for freedom fighters residing inside. They are also a source for medical items such as bandages or epinephrine, which can be obtained by spending resources at the tent.

FOBs are field bases and as such, offer fewer capabilities than military bases, and their armory and equipment assortment is limited to resistance assets. However, they can be established very early, before the resistance is strong enough to overtake a military base, and/or may be placed in very advantageous locations.

They are somewhat complementary to FOBs, as they offer more possibilities at the cost of their fixed placement.
Fighters will find here regular army equipment of the allied forces and more construction options.

FOBs can be established by resistance members using the entrenchment tool, via the placement menu. They need to be placed at a sufficient distance from enemy-controlled facilities, towns and other points of interest. You can use FOB Placement map tool to plan the location in advance.
There are two types of operating bases, as described below.

Military bases are existing locations in the world, controlled by the enemy. After they are taken over,
they can be used as operating bases.

Operating bases are locations in which resistance members can construct buildings and fortifications, store resources, operate garages, repair and refuel vehicles, and more. If enough resources are stored, an operating base may be used as a respawn location.

Repair stations allow to repair vehicles of relevant category. To repair ground vehicles, build a vehicle maintenance ramp. To repair helicopters, build a service helipad. Follow base game mechanics to carry out the repairs - equip yourself with a wrench and approach the damaged elements until you see a relevant action. The repairs will consume resources stored at the location.
As the resources for construction are pulled from the base pool, the first supply storage in a base can be constructed without spending any resources.
Resources in storage are persistent and do not expire or decay.

Storages are always the first construction to be raised in an operating base. They store resources of different types and make them available to use within a base. Different to base game supply system, resources in Freedom Fighters are not vicinity based and cannot be used directly from trucks and other sources.
Depending on your difficulty settings, you may see a status icon denoting whether your character is perceived as a combatant.
The absence of a shirt, pants, or boots will cause your character to attract enemy attention. After all, someone running around in only their underwear is bound to look suspicious.

Appearance reflects how your character is perceived by others and depends on all worn attire and held items. Wearing any piece of military clothing will cause your character to be identified as a combatant. This means enemies will shoot on sight and mark you as wanted — the same applies to openly carrying any type of weapon.
As the base game does not contain any civilian backpacks, the general purpose military ones are not treated as military equipment.

- Deployment phase - The enemy is still deploying onto the battlefield. The progress bar is yellow and represents how much of their forces are already fielded. Once the bar completes, the battle will transition into domination phase.
- Domination phase - The sides fight for control. The progress bar is green and represents resistance control over the location. Control will increase every few moments if there are more freedom fighters in the contested area than enemies in the near vicinity.

Battles occur when control over a certain point of interest is contested. When a battle is won, the contesting faction takes control. Refer to the specific location description to learn how to provoke a battle. Only one battle can be active at any given moment and its progress cannot be saved. If the game is closed during a battle, the battle will need to be started from the beginning. Battle length and intensity depend on the number of players online, campaign progress, location significance, and threat level.
Each battle consists of two phases:
If there are no freedom fighters in the contested area, the resistance will begin to rapidly lose control. In this case, the progress bar will turn red. Once the bar fills, the battle will be lost.

Once a battle begins, everyone will see a notification. A progress bar will appear at the top of the screen, accompanied by the location name. The battle location will also be marked on the map, denoting the contested area by a stripe pattern.

- Civilian shops will not serve you
- Resistance representatives may not want to talk to you
- Public transport becomes unavailable
- Resting becomes unavailable
- ...and more.

Various activities may cause your character to become wanted. This means your character is actively hunted by enemy forces and will be shot on sight, even if you appear as a civilian. Being wanted also has many negative side effects, such as:

Heat level is a measure of how much your character is wanted by the enemy. Once it drops to 0, you will no longer be wanted. Heat decreases over time as long as you stay out of sight of enemy troops. Your current heat level is represented by the fill level of the wanted status icon in the HUD. The time required to fully lose maximum heat depends on your difficulty settings.
If your character dies, the heat level and wanted state does not transfer to your new character.
Visible if your character is considered a combatant. This is caused by carrying weapons, using military vehicles, and wearing military attire — or wearing no attire at all.
Visible if your character is within an illegal area.
Visible if your character is undercover, which means it’s impersonating an enemy soldier.
Visible when your character is within enemy sight. Pulling out weapons, acting suspiciously, or committing crimes is not the best idea.
Visible if your character is wanted. Its fill level represents how much heat your character has, which reduces over time as you remain hidden.

Character status is indicated by various icons shown on the HUD in the upper-right corner of the screen.
Depending on your difficulty settings, some of the indicators listed below may not be displayed in your game.

Visible if your character has been detected as a threat and is within enemy sight. If you are at a distance, concealed, or in the dark, it will take longer for the enemies to recognize you. When this happens, the icon will gradually fill up, giving you a brief chance to hide.

You can command a squad using the vanilla commanding system. Your subordinates are persistent and in multiplayer sessions enter and exit the game with you. If your character dies, your squad will become detached. Any player, including you, can take command over a detached fighter by approaching them and using an action. Therefore, you can regain command if you return to your former squad with a new character quickly enough. A detached squad will disappear if there is no one nearby for a certain time.

Placeable objects are smaller props that are paid for in money by the placing person. If an item can be owned, it will be automatically linked to the person placing it (for example: item storages). Right now placed items cannot be moved or removed.

Construction includes placement of various items in the world and building structures. Both these actions are available via radial menu, but will only appear if your character is equipped with an entrenching tool. Moreover, construction is only possible at operating bases controlled by the resistance.

Buildable structures cost resources, which are taken from the location storage. Right now raised structures cannot be moved or removed. Structures belong to the resistance in general and are not linked to the specific person constructing them.

There are many areas that are forbidden to enter for civilians. Any players spotted in these areas will be instantly shot and hunted. Depending on your settings, these areas will be marked in red on your map and/or you will see a status icon on your HUD upon entering them. There is no need to frantically check your map to avoid entering them by accident - they are usually fenced and accompany military bases, outposts, factories, and other military or strategic points of interest.
Military personnel is allowed to be present within illegal zones. You can disguise yourself in enemy uniform to walk around freely.
If you are extremely desperate, you can try extorting defenceless civilians. This should be your last resort, as it turns them hostile against you and makes you lose their hard-earned support.

Money makes the world go around and it is no different in *Freedom Fighters*. You will need it to buy gear, supplies, hire subordinates and expand your bases. Amount of possessed money can be checked at any moment by opening the inventory menu.

Your money is virtual, which means there is no in-game wallet item and your balance is tied to your player profile. What happens with your balance in case of your character death depends on your difficulty settings - ranging from no penalty, through fixed fee, to a complete loss.

Earning methods
There are multiple ways to make money, but collecting enemy dogtags and turning them in to the resistance is the most rewarding one. You can also sell equipment looted from the enemy.
You can select the currency used in your run during game setup. Selected currency format has no effect on the gameplay and is purely a cosmetic/role-playing change.

Transferring
You can transfer money to another freedom fighter by accessing the radial menu and selecting the Transfer money option. To do so, you need to be in the immediate vicinity of the recipient. After money is sent, the transferee will receive a notification mentioning the sender name and amount of money received.

To acquire ownership over an item, it must have no prior owner. In that case, you will see a Claim ownership action on the item. Just use it to claim the item as your own. If you are placing objects and the object can be owned, you will automatically claim ownership over it.

Sometimes you may also want to pass the ownership to another player, for example if you are building containers for your squad. In that case you can use Abandon ownership action to release the item. Afterwards, it can be claimed by any other player. Abandoning the item will also automatically unlock it.

Various items in the world can be owned by freedom fighters — such as containers placed in operating bases and vehicles found in the world. The owner can lock the item, restricting other players’ access. Both lock state and ownership is persisted. This is useful if you want to keep your personal belongings secure, or make sure no reckless driver hijacks your valuable vehicle at a resistance base.

Basic features available via the radial menu include:
- Accessing journal, containing details about your current tasks
- Accessing campaign progress menu, which lists your high-level objectives required to win the uprising
- Transferring money to nearby freedom fighters
- Accessing placing and construction menus
- Accessing placing and construction menus

Open the radial menu by pressing U to access various features specific to *Freedom Fighters*. This menu is context-aware,
which means the options available within the menu may depend on your character state, objects in your vicinity,
equipped tools and other. When additional options are available, you will usually see an on-screen prompt
in the lower part of your screen.

You can use any handheld radio to communicate with the resistance. To do so, you must equip the radio in hand and interact with it using the radial menu. You will see a call to action when the interaction is available. Remember to turn the radio on and tune it to required frequency. You also need to be within range of a controlled radio site.

After joining the fight for the first time, or after an unfortunate death, the player will be faced with the deployment map tool. In this view, they can select the respawn location they wish to use. If there is no location available, the player has to wait until remaining players reenable respawn availability. If there are no remaining players alive, the campaign will fail.

To spawn in a town, there must be at least one supporter in the local population. By spawning, the player takes control of a civilian character that is taken away from the supporters amount. Town population is not affected by this.

Spawning at operating bases consumes a certain amount of resources, depending on the operating base type. Respawn cost, along with available resources at the base, is always shown in the deployment map tool.
Spawned character will have a mix of resistance clothes and no equipment at all.
Spawned character will have civilian clothes, a basic handgun, a map and some bag.
You can use most beds found in the world to rest. Resting advances time, which is useful if you want to skip night-time or, to the contrary, you want to carry out an assault in the dark.

Additionally:
- Character cannot be wanted
- If character is in combat attire, there cannot be enemies nearby
- Bed cannot be in illegal area

To rest, you have to interact with a bed and select resting duration in the menu. In multiplayer, all players spawned in-world need to get near beds and confirm their readiness to rest. It is not possible to change planned rest duration while players are waiting. To do so, all players must cancel their readiness (or exit resting menu), which will clear currently planned rest.
Once all required players are ready, a timelapse will occur, fast-forwarding by the selected duration.
Each player needs to have a wristwatch in order to wake up at the planned time.

Depending on your difficulty settings, resting may heal player characters.
Damage is healed in full, independently of the rest duration.
Depending on your difficulty settings, you will see a status icon when your character is undercover.

By wearing complete enemy uniform your character can go undercover. In this state, you can enter illegal areas, openly carry weapons (if the weapon belongs to the enemy faction), and drive enemy vehicles without attracting attention. The cover can be blown if you act suspiciously or open fire.

When starting a new game, you can modify various settings to adjust the difficulty and mechanics to your play style. Although these are collectively called difficulty settings, some of the choices are rather a matter of preference. Right now those settings can only be adjusted when starting a new campaign.

You can quickly change all settings by selecting one of the predefined presets. Selecting a preset does not prevent you from adjusting the settings further - if you change any of the options, the preset selector will automatically switch to Custom, retaining all other settings from the preset. This way you can use any of the presets as a starting point.
If this is your first playthrough, we recommend using Normal preset to experience a balanced gameplay the way it was envisioned.

Whether you launch via single player scenario, host a local server or set up a dedicated server, new Freedom Fighters game is started using an ingame UI. All three playing methods are supported. Moreover, you can freely switch between single player and a locally hosted server - your campaign progres will carry over seamlessly.

If there is no saved data present, all joining players will see a pre game screen. If you are playing on a dedicated server, you need to log in as an admin to configure the game and launch it. This is automatic for single players and local hosts.

- player faction: the resistance faction. Irregular forces that will use a mix of their own and allied faction equipment.
- enemy faction: the occupier faction. Regular and organized army, controlling all significant points on the map, with no shortage of assets.
- allied faction: external power that supplies the resistance with political and military aid. Not directly present in the world, but the resistance may have access to some of its weapons and vehicles.
- civilian faction: the local population, present in towns and non-military facilities. Depending on world events, specific characters may become supporters of the resistance or occupier forces and become involved.

During pre game you can select faction configuration and multiple difficulty options. Setup and difficulty settings cannot be changed later. Ability to change difficulty settings during a campaign will be added in future.

Other settings
You can also change the displayed format of the ingame currency to your liking. This is purely a cosmetic feature and has no impact on the actual gameplay mechanics.

Due to many additional features, Freedom Fighters is not automatically compatible with modded factions. In the base version, you can play as FIA, and choose between USA and USSR in allied and occupier faction roles. Support for outstanding community created factions will be added in future.

Vehicles found in the world are not persistent by default - regardless whether you capture them on the go, or hijack from a parking spot. To preserve a vehicle during save/load, you have to assign it to a parking spot in a garage or a helipad at a controlled operating base.

If your character dies, their body will be persisted after you disconnect or exit, enabling you to return to it. But if you lose your next character, the previous body will be removed - only the last body is preserved.

Freedom Fighters is a semi-persistent scenario, which means that overall game progress is saved, but not the exact state of the world. Global save is performed periodically every 10 minutes to protect players from losing progress due to a fatal crash, and on every server exit (or closing the game in single player). In multiplayer, the player profile is saved on player disconnect.
This means that every fight counts and you can effectively clear garrisons by war of attrition, small chunks at a time.
Claiming ownership of a vehicle does not affect its persistence.
Your AI subordinates are saved with your character. In multiplayer they will join and leave the server with you.

Specific enemy characters are not saved, so if you exit the game while surrounded by enemies, they will be gone after you load the game. Garrison compositions are however saved, which means if you attack a place of interest and eliminate a single enemy, that specific character will not automatically reappear. If you clear a location, but do not capture it, it will remain empty after the load - of course, unless enemy reinforcements arrive!

If you abandon a vehicle in the world and get sufficiently far away, it may be gone once you get back! Assigning the vehicle to a parking spot also prevents this. Additionally, you will be able to recover the vehicle from far away.
Your character position and inventory is fully saved. On return you will spawn at the same location you have exited, so make sure to exit the game while in a safe location!

Proceed to the factory and clear the enemy garrison. You’ll likely face heavy resistance, but you can tackle it in stages. If you’re playing solo, consider using a sniper rifle to harass enemies from a distance, frequently changing position to avoid detection. In other situations, a frontal assault with AI squadmates may be effective.

Getting supplies becomes much easier once you’ve captured your first factory. It will passively produce new supplies each day, which you can transport to your FOBs, hideouts, or donate to towns. Factories continue production even when you skip time by resting in beds, so you can use this mechanism at moments of downtime. You should now focus on capturing additional factories to maximize your production throughput.

Your next priority should be to establish a network of hideouts across all towns. To do this, you need to increase support in each of them. Don’t focus on a single location - instead, spread your efforts: hang posters in town A, donate supplies in town B, move on to town C, and eventually return to A. This rotation helps avoid diminishing returns and keeps the threat level moderately low.

Now you’re ready to capture an enemy factory. Choose one near your FOB, or establish a new one. Make sure it’s stocked with weapons, ammunition, and medical items - either bring them manually or provide enough supplies so they can be purchased from the armory, medical tent, or other facilities. Set up a garage and park at least two vehicles. Whether you’re playing solo or with others, you can also build a living area to command a squad of recruits during the assault.

Once you have a steady surplus of supplies, you can start taking over towns and military bases using the same process - ultimately leading to the liberation of all territories and victory in the campaign.

Start by completing the introductory storyline. By the end of it, you should have established your first FOB and learned how to earn money by collecting enemy dogtags, as well as how to raise support by hanging propaganda posters.

Once you clear the garrison and enter the factory area, a battle will begin. Thanks to your hideout network, friendly fighters should arrive to help even the odds. If your character is killed, you’ll be able to quickly respawn at your FOB, grab a vehicle, and return to the battle before it’s lost.

Every new hideout will make your life a little easier - reducing travel time to resupply, pick up posters, or report mission progress. Once your hideouts are established, stock them with supplies, including your HQ. Resupplied hideouts enable the resistance to dispatch fighters who can assist in capturing key points of interest.

Placing posters and talking to people may not be enough in towns with larger populations. The most effective method is donating supplies, which at this point can be obtained in one of the following ways:
- Purchase with money at ports: Earn money by turning in dogtags, completing resistance missions, or selling loot at shops.
- Raid an enemy factory: Go in guns blazing, or infiltrate undercover and casually drive off with the cargo.
- Ambush enemy transports: Enemy trucks may carry varying amounts of supplies.
- Loot enemy checkpoints: Occasionally, you may find a pile of supplies nearby.

In the meantime, consider capturing radio and radar sites, which will help you consolidate your control over territory. This makes traveling safer, as enemy patrols will only appear in zones still under their control.
Make sure to have at least one dose of epinephrine on you. It can be self-administered if you get downed, which is crucial for lone wolves.
Bloodied clothes will make you wanted on sight. If your clothes are bloodied, you will see a hint on the inventory screen.

Enemy garrisons will usually outnumber you or your group, but don’t worry - every attack and every eliminated  enemy counts, and eventually you will win the war of attrition. Apply hit & run tactics - approach a base, snipe a few enemies, send a rocket and vanish in the woods. Rinse and repeat.
You can use public payphones to report resistance activity and lure the enemy into an ambush, or provoke a battle.
You can also steal supplies from an enemy factory without capturing it. Likewise, create distraction, drive up in an enemy cargo truck while disguised, load supplies and get away quickly!
You can purchase civilian clothes in a clothing shop. It may be useful to store a few sets at your military base, so you can disguise as a civilian after respawning.

Before trying to capture an enemy base, build a FOB nearby and stock it with resources to respawn there. Place a garage and assign a vehicle that will act as a taxi. Even if your entire squad dies and the vehicle stays left on the battlefield, you will be able to recover it remotely from the FOB. In this manner you will be able to deliver reinforcements sustainably.
Make sure to stock your hideouts fully before attempting to capture a town or a military base. The supplies will allow friendlies to take part in the battle.

You can use any handheld radio to contact the resistance officer if you are within signal range of a controlled radio site. Remember to tune your radio to correct frequency according to the timetable.
The HQ will be shut down and moved to a new location if you endanger it. Any stocked supplies will be lost in the process, wasting the resistance efforts.
Passing ambulances may contain significant amounts of medical items, including epinephrine, in their trunks. Medics may also carry epinephrine.

You can capture enemy APCs or helicopters in the early game. Scout the location and ask for distraction at the other side of the enemy compound. Disguise yourself in enemy uniform to enter the illegal zone freely and hijack the vehicle, while everyone’s attention is elsewhere.

Do not get into a fight if you don’t have a way out. Situation usually escalates very quickly and you may find yourself surrounded and overwhelmed, even if you had the upper hand at the start. Have an exit strategy and don’t be afraid to break contact. You can always come later and try again.

At any point, you can check your campaign progress using the radial menu accessed by and selecting the appropriate option. Note that total progress includes optional objectives, not required for victory, therefore it is possible to finish the campaign without reaching 100% completion.

The resistance will be defeated if no freedom fighter is alive, and there is no respawn location available in the world. This can be caused by lack of resources, lack of population support, being overrun with enemies, or other reasons depending on the respawn location type. Look up Respawn in FM to learn more.

Freedom Fighters is an open-world campaign, but not open-ended. There are specific conditions in which your uprising will either achieve victory or defeat. When this happens, the campaign will end and you will have to start all over.

In order to reach victory, the resistance has to have control over or neutralize all of the following points of interest:
- towns
- factories
- military bases
- radio towers
- radar sites
Only with all of the above will the resistance have enough political and military power to upkeep its rule.
Each supporter will donate a small amount of money to the resistance every day. The funds are then split equally and sent to all present freedom fighters automatically.

Population support is required indirectly to finish the campaign. Without it, you won’t be able to control all required points of interest. It counts towards the progress, so you need to convince every single person to reach 100%.

Civilian population is a key element in your revolution. After all, it is their freedom you are fighting for. Just incidentally they also happen to fuel your efforts with money and manpower. Each civilian may have one of the following stances regarding revolution:
- supporting: friendly to the resistance members and disapproving of the occupier.
- neutral: no stance, the initial state for most of the population. They don’t really care about the revolution or the occupier forces. They can be turned into supporters, given enough reasons to.
- hostile: actively against the revolution and supporting the occupier. They cannot be turned into supporters, but given enough time they may become neutral.

You can inspect general population stats in the campaign progress menu. To check local trends, inspect selected town on the map. Population composition is represented by a progress bar, with color-coded segments proportional to the popularity of relevant stance.

Population moods will change in reaction to your actions. While civilians are rather tolerant to acts of war and inconveniences caused by combat against the occupier, any wrongdoings towards them will turn them hostile very quickly. Keep in mind your supporters may become hostile just as well, negating your hard-earned friendliness.

Free stuff is an excellent method to gain supporters, whether you are a politician, or… a politician-to-be.  If you win the revolution, of course. The downside is that you actually have to bring the stuff to the table.  But here comes the good news - when it’s free, nobody will ask you how you got it.

Donating supplies is a rather expensive method, unless you have a surplus of your own production. Supplies are also vital to your own operations, so giving them away in the early stages of the revolution may not be the best choice.

There is no limit as to how many supplies and how often you can donate to a specific town, but many donations over a short period of time will stop having an effect on the support. It’s best to diversify and distribute the supplies evenly to many towns in a concurrent manner. Donation effects wear out after some time, so you can come back
and donate another shipment later.

Load your vehicle with supplies and drive to the exact location of the town marker, as shown on your map. Come to a full stop once you are within 50 meters from the marker. A prompt should appear, and the donation option will be available in the radial menu.

Once convinced to support the resistance, civilians will not change their mind on their own.  Remember that each supporter can still turn hostile if you give them a good enough reason to. Opposite to supporters, civilians will typically turn hostile immediately in response to your actions. In that case, there is nothing you can do to change their mind except for waiting.

Placing up posters is a very effective early method to raise awareness about your revolution and gain support. It’s more time-effective than personal agitation, as you can reach many people with a single poster.

There is a trade-off however, as the amount of posters - and thus the support you can generate this way - is limited. As the posters are meant to be visible - they are also visible to enemy forces too, and will raise the local threat level.
Distributing propaganda is a crime, and doing it within enemy sight will make you wanted.
Posters can be obtained from resistance officers using the relevant dialogue option.

To place a poster, you need to equip it in your left hand (just like any other item). You will see a ghost of the poster in front of you. The ghost color will change to gray if the placement is valid, and yellow if it cannot be placed.
Postering all spots is not required to finish the campaign, but is required to reach 100% completion.

Posters can only be attached to specific objects (usually boards, signs, cabinets, advertising columns and similar), which are marked on your map with a posterable icon. Once an item has been postered, the icon is removed.

There are multiple ways to gain support, including:
- direct agitation by approaching and talking to individual persons
- placing up propaganda posters to increase visibility and awareness
- donating supplies to townsfolk

Gaining support is a process which takes time. Most actions will not yield immediate results, but will resonate  over time instead. For example, if you place posters, it takes some time for them to be noticed. If you donate supplies, it takes some time for the word to spread around, and so on. You can inspect towns on the map to view currently active effects and their expiration time. Once an effect expires, it will stop attracting new supporters and will be removed.
Some methods are described in detail in their dedicated Field Manual pages.
Factories are crucial for your revolution, as they can provide a steady stream of resources, which are much needed for any war efforts.

Each factory controlled by the resistance will produce certain resources, depending on the factory type. Those resources may then be freely utilized by freedom fighters as deemed fit. On each factory area there is at least one resource storage, in which the produced resources are placed. Those storages are always marked on the map and feature a sign.

Factories are usually guarded by an enemy forces garrison. Once the garrison is cleared and the area is secured, a battle will follow. Be careful, as during factory working hours civilian workers will be present in the factory area. After repelling enemy forces the resistance will take control over the factory. All factories must be controlled by the resistance in order to achieve victory.

Military bases are the backbone of enemy occupation over the area. All bases need to be controlled by the resistance    to achieve victory, but be warned, they are heavily guarded and the enemy won’t let control over them easily.
In order to take control, the resistance has to win a battle over the base. A battle can be initiated by interacting with the military base flag post.
Once under resistance control, the military base becomes resistance’s operating base, which means the resistance may start construction in its area. See relevant Field Manual section for more info.

Radar sites cannot be captured by the resistance, only neutralized. To do so, the resistance has to destroy all radar dishes present on the site. Even if the defending garrison is cleared without damage to the equipment, the resistance has no qualified crews to operate the installations.
Radar sites are operated by the enemy and need to be neutralized to achieve victory. With enemy radar sites in operation, allied forces are not able to provide required support.
Radio towers are always guarded by an enemy garrison. To take control, the resistance has to simply secure the area by clearing its garrison.

Radio towers are used to enable communication for the controlling faction and jam opposing forces. All radio towers need to be either neutralized or controlled by the resistance to achieve victory. Towers may be destroyed, in which case neither side will control it. This also counts towards campaign progress.

On the other hand, sometimes you may want to increase threat and provoke a response from the enemy deliberately, for example to contest town control. In this case, some warning shots in the air or an ambush on a random enemy vehicle should be enough. You can also locate the nearest phone booth and report resistance activity in the town.

Threat level denotes how much trouble the resistance has been recently making. The bigger the threat, the more activity from enemy forces you can expect. Killings, shootings, and even sightings of resistance fighters will rapidly increase threat. Threat will decay over time, so if you are facing too much enemy activity, it is best to change the area of operations for some time and come back later.

Towns are key places for your revolution. Most importantly, they are the home of the local population, whose support is desperately needed. Towns come in three sizes: villages, towns and cities, based on the number of residents and their infrastructure.

To control a town, the resistance has to have a certain amount of supporters among the town residents. Detailed information is always shown in the town info panel. Raising support is enough to control villages, but in the case of bigger settlements, enemy forces will not stay indifferent. When the town’s threat level gets sufficiently high, the occupier will attempt to pacify the town and a battle will begin. As a result, the winning side will take control over the town.
Be wary that the resistance will lose control over a town if the population support falls below a certain threshold.

Friendly fighters are resistance members or supporting civilians that decided to take part in the fight. They will appear during battles over various points of interest, such as towns, military bases, factories and others. They are autonomous and you cannot directly control them, but they will fight along side you with the enemy. However, their presence depends on your actions, as each fighter needs to be equipped with weapons and ammunition, and that in turn requires supplies.

Friendly fighters consume supplies stored at hideouts. If the location being fought for hosts a hideout - such as a town - then the fighters will appear and take supplies only from that specific hideout. Otherwise - when attacking factories or military bases - the supplies are consumed across all resistance hideouts, including the HQ. Supplies stored at resistance operating bases (FOBs, military bases) and controlled factories are not taken into account.
Hideout officers also offer guns, ammunition, and other war materials - all available in exchange for money.

There is always one HQ hideout in the world. However, if you endanger it, it will cease operations and must be relocated. This process may take several hours, during which the HQ will be inaccessible. Any supplies stored there will be lost during the move, so take care to avoid triggering a relocation.

The HQ’s location is not automatically revealed on your map. To discover its position, you must either call the HQ using a phone or contact it via radio, and then travel to the coordinates you are given.

HQ hideouts are established in safer locations - typically in remote houses away from densely populated areas or in small, secluded settlements. They serve as delivery and pickup points for various resistance operations and act as rally points where mercenary fighters can be recruited.

Hideouts are secure locations used by the resistance for meetings and covert communication. At each hideout, you can meet a resistance officer - your primary contact for all conspiratorial matters. Speak with them to receive new assignments. Keep in mind that they’re not particularly fond of attracting attention from the authorities, so avoid visiting them when you have heat on you.

The resistance will establish hideouts in towns and cities once there is enough local support to sustain its operations. Same goes the other way - if you lose too much support, resistance operations will become unsustainable and the hideout will be dissolved. Keeping a network of hideouts is very important, as each additional hideout means more storage space for supplies, which are used to arm your fighters during battles.

Missions and their progress is, at any stage, fully persistent. It is a good idea to look up the journal upon joining an existing online session to check out if there are any already started missions.

You can receive missions by talking to the resistance officer. Missions are shared by all ingame players and it does not matter which player takes or reports them. If the mission is awarded with money, the amount is automatically split between all ingame players.

You can recruit resistance fighters at HQ hideouts existing in the world or living areas constructed by players at the resistance operating bases. Recruited fighters can be commanded as members of your squad.

Phones can be used to make calls to known contacts using the phonebook, or by dialling a number manually. Once phone is interacted with, a radial menu will appear enabling to choose the preferred method.

Ports can be used to import supplies from abroad, an essential resource representing various commodities essential both for everyday life and development of your facilities. Supplies can be bought for money after interacting with the storage area sign. Each port has a limited storage of supplies, but after a few days the stock should be replenished. Port storages are independent from each other and are refilled independently.
Once supplies are purchased, they will be placed in the pickup area. Don’t worry if you can’t haul all goods in one go - those supplies are secure and will be waiting for pickup after you return.

Public transport can be used to quickly travel around the map. You can use busesv to travel on roads and ferries to navigate the water bodies. Every passenger has to buy a ticket each time they travel, price of which depends on the distance traveled. Sometimes certain stops may become temporarily unavailable, for example due to ongoing battles or administrative decisions of the authorities.
To travel, you have to appear as a civilian and cannot be wanted.

Various civilian shops can be found in the world, offering diverse assortment of goods. At general shops, you can buy various items intended for tourism, which are also incidentally useful if you plan to conduct guerilla warfare - such as compasses, watches or binoculars. Clothing shops may be useful if you want to get rid of your uniform and blend into the crowd. If you intend to be shot, make sure to visit the pharmacy beforehand.

While item stocks are limited, they usually get replenished before next business day begins. Shops will not want to serve you if you are wanted. Also keep in mind the current time of day - each shop has specific business hours, outside of which you will not be served.
Problems were detected with one or more of selected factions. Please report this problem to the integration author along with complete log files.
An unknown error occured. Check logs for details and report this to the mod authors.
Scenario or terrain validation failed. Please report this problem to the scenario author along with a full set of log files.

Please keep in mind this project is in an early access state. Some features may not be fully developed yet, or may be temporary or placeholders.

Be sure to check out your journal and the Field Manual so you don't get lost.

If you have any questions or feedback, feel free to join our Discord community by scanning the code.

Good luck!
Translation: Pamiętaj, że ten projekt jest w stanie wczesnym dostępem . Niektóre funkcje mogą nie być jeszcze w pełni rozwinięte lub mogą być tymczasowe lub zastępcze.

Source: Start an uprising and lead your people to freedom in this open-world persistent campaign.
Translation: Rozpocznij powstanie i poprowadź swoich ludzi do wolności w tej uporczywej kampanii w otwartym świecie.

Source: Base amount received by players periodically from each supporter of the resistance.
Players will become wanted if they are seen in clothes bloodied above this level. Set to 0 to disable.
Enables an epinephrine injector item, which instantly recovers full health. Disabling this option on existing saves will not remove items from the world, but they will not be usable.
Dynamically adjusts loot found on killed enemies, making scavenging for items more diverse and sustained use of enemy weapons more challenging. Disable if you want abundance of enemy equipment.
Can the epinephrine be self-administered by a downed player.
How long does the player have to withstand in the downed state in order to self-administer epinephrine.
How long does it take to lose maximum heat level (wanted state).

Automatically resupplies AI units with ammunition and consumable items as they are used. Enable for longer and more intense firefights, disable if you use other mods that enable AI to resupply autonomously.
Only relevant in multiplayer. If turned off, any already locked player containers will become accessible, but the ownership data is not cleared, and the setting may be reverted.
Only relevant in multiplayer. If turned off, any already locked vehicles will become accessible, but the ownership data is not cleared, and the setting may be reverted.
Enable to treat players who are missing shirts, pants or shoes as combatants.
Displays status indicators of other players in their nametags. Specific indicators have to be also enabled in HUD section.
Options other than Default require third person view to be enabled in Reforger server settings.
Respawn money cost is not deducted if player's balance is below this threshold.
Should this item be always included in player inventory when spawning as a resistance fighter.
Cost of respawning as a resistance member in operating bases.
Number of supporters deducted for spawning as a civilian.
Higher stock levels allow faster early-game progression, since you can start raiding factories earlier. This only affects the initial allocation.
Resistance supporters act as respawn tickets. Increase this if you're playing in a larger group.
Clustered distribution will place your initial supporters in the same region of the map. Spreaded will randomize them throughout entire map, which can make the beginning harder on large maps.
This amount is given to each new player on their first spawn.
This hideout is not operational due to imminent danger.
Translation: Ta kryjówka nie działa z powodu zbliżającego się niebezpieczeństwa.

Source: You cannot do that with a disabled radio.
Translation: Nie możesz tego zrobić z niepełnosprawnym radiem.

Source: You cannot do this with enemies nearby.
Translation: Nie możesz tego zrobić z wrogami w pobliżu.

Source: You cannot do this in illegal zone.
Translation: Nie możesz tego zrobić w strefie nielegalnej.

Source: Your vehicle must not be moving to do this.
Translation: Twój pojazd nie może się do tego poruszać.

Source: You cannot do that while in vehicle.
Translation: Nie możesz tego zrobić w pojeździe.

Source: You do not have enough money.
You do not have required resources.
You cannot do that while undercover.
Translation: Nie możesz tego zrobić podczas tajnego.

Source: You cannot do that while carrying weapons or in uniform. Hide your weapon and/or swap clothes.
Translation: Nie możesz tego zrobić podczas noszenia broni lub w mundurze. Ukryj swoją broń i/lub zamień ubrania.

Source: You cannot do that while being wanted. Wait until heat drops off and come back later.
Translation: Nie możesz tego zrobić, będąc poszukiwanym. Poczekaj, aż ciepło spadnie i wróć później.

Source: You need a map to do that.
You need a watch to do that.
You extorted change money from this person. They will support the enemy from now on!
Translation: Wyprzedzliłeś zmienić pieniądze od tej osoby. Od teraz będą wspierać wroga!

Source: This person has no money to extort.
Translation: Ta osoba nie ma pieniędzy na wyłuszenie.

Source: This person already supports the resistance.
You have convinced this person to support resistance.
Translation: Przekonałeś tę osobę do poparcia oporu.

Source: This person supports enemy and cannot be convinced to your cause.
Translation: Ta osoba popiera wroga i nie może być przekonana do twojej sprawy.

Source: You failed to convince this person to support your cause.
Translation: Nie udało ci się przekonać tej osoby do poparcia twojej sprawy.

Source: You can't talk with this person right now.
Translation: Nie możesz teraz rozmawiać z tą osobą.

Source: There are no destinations you can fast travel to right now.
Translation: Nie ma teraz miejsc, do których możesz szybko podróżować.

Source: Destination is too close to fast travel.
Translation: Miejsce docelowe jest zbyt blisko, aby szybko podróżować.

Source: This vehicle cannot be parked on this type of spot.
Translation: Ten pojazd nie może być zaparkowany w tego rodzaju miejscu.

Source: Vehicle has been parked. You can now use the garage to retrieve the vehicle from far away.
Translation: Pojazd został zaparkowany. Możesz teraz użyć garażu do odzyskania pojazdu z daleka.

Source: This vehicle is too large to fit into that parking spot.
Translation: Ten pojazd jest zbyt duży, aby zmieścić się w tym miejscu parkingowym.

Source: Vehicle cannot be retrieved because the parking spot is obstructed.
Translation: Pojazdu nie można odzyskać, ponieważ miejsce parkingowe jest utrudnione.

Source: Vehicle is too close to be retrieved.
Translation: Pojazd jest zbyt blisko, aby go odzyskać.

Source: Another vehicle is already assigned to this parking slot. You can abandon that vehicle and free up the spot by accessing garage management.
Translation: Kolejny pojazd jest już przypisany do tego miejsca parkingowego. Możesz porzucić ten pojazd i zwolnić miejsce, uzyskując dostęp do zarządzania garażem.

Source: There is no vehicle assigned to the parking spot.
Translation: Nie ma pojazdu przypisanego do miejsca parkingowego.

Source: You do not have enough space in inventory to store the item. It has been placed on the ground.
You failed to pick the lock.
There is no one nearby to transfer money to.
Translation: Nie ma w pobliżu nikogo, kto mógłby przenieść pieniądze.

Source: You are too far away to transfer money.
Translation: Jesteś za daleko, aby przenieść pieniądze.

Source: The same faction cannot be used as civilians and a conflict side simultaneously. Please select different factions to continue.
Translation: Tej samej frakcji nie można jednocześnie wykorzystywać jako cywile i konflikt. Wybierz różne frakcje, aby kontynuować.

Source: The same faction cannot be used as enemy and allied forces simultaneously. Please select different factions to continue.
Translation: Tej samej frakcji nie można jednocześnie używać jako siły wroga i sojusznicze. Wybierz różne frakcje, aby kontynuować.

Source: The same faction cannot be selected for players and another conflict side simultaneously. Please select different factions to continue.
Translation: Tej samej frakcji nie można wybrać jednocześnie dla graczy i innej strony konfliktu. Wybierz różne frakcje, aby kontynuować.

Source: You have abandoned ownership over this item.
You claimed ownership over this item. This allows you to control who can access it.
Translation: Doszedłeś do wniosku o własność tego przedmiotu. To pozwala kontrolować, kto może do niego uzyskać dostęp.

Source: This item cannot be attached to this object.
Translation: Tego elementu nie można dołączyć do tego obiektu.

Source: You are too close to an enemy checkpoint to place here.
Translation: Jesteś zbyt blisko wrogowego punktu kontrolnego, aby umieścić tutaj.

Source: You are too close to an enemy camp to place here.
Translation: Jesteś zbyt blisko obozu wroga, aby tu umieścić.

Source: You are too close to a factory to place here.
Translation: Jesteś zbyt blisko fabryki, aby tu umieścić.

Source: You cannot place this in an illegal zone.
Translation: Nie możesz tego umieścić w nielegalnej strefie.

Source: You are too close to a military base to place here.
Translation: Jesteś zbyt blisko bazy wojskowej, aby tu umieścić.

Source: You are too close to a camp to place here.
You are too close to an existing FOB to place here.
Translation: Jesteś zbyt blisko istniejącego FOB, aby umieścić tutaj.

Source: You are too close to a port to place here.
Translation: Jesteś zbyt blisko portu, aby umieścić tutaj.

Source: You are too close to an enemy radar site to place here.
Translation: Jesteś zbyt blisko strony radaru wroga, aby umieścić tutaj.

Source: You are too close to an enemy radio tower to place here.
Translation: Jesteś zbyt blisko wieży radiowej wroga.

Source: You are too close to a town to place here.
Translation: Jesteś zbyt blisko miasta, aby tu umieścić.

Source: No more objects can be placed in this area.
This item has to be placed on a vertical surface.
Translation: Ten przedmiot musi być umieszczony na pionowej powierzchni.

Source: A poster has been already placed here.
Selected placement is too close to another poster.
Translation: Wybrane umieszczenie jest zbyt blisko innego plakatu.

Source: No more posters can be placed in this area.
Translation: W tym obszarze nie można umieścić więcej plakatów.

Source: There is no space left to store the resources.
Translation: Nie ma miejsca na przechowywanie zasobów.

Source: This respawn location is now unavailable.
Translation: Ta lokalizacja odrodzenia jest teraz niedostępna.

Source: You can't respawn at any location right now.
Translation: Nie możesz teraz odrodzić się w żadnym miejscu.

Source: This shop is currently closed. Come back later within business hours.
Translation: Ten sklep jest obecnie zamknięty. Wróć później w godzinach pracy.

Source: You have no space in your inventory to buy this item.
Translation: Nie masz miejsca w swoim ekwipunku, aby kupić ten przedmiot.

Source: Not enough space in storage to perform purchase.
Translation: Za mało miejsca w magazynie, aby wykonać zakup.

Source: You do not have any supplies that could be donated.
Translation: Nie masz żadnych zapasów, które można przekazać.

Source: You have donated supplies to the town.
%1, a civilian, has been killed near %2.
%1 has been killed by friendly fire near %2.
Translation: %1 został zabity przez przyjazny pożar w pobliżu %2.

Source: %1, a %3 fighter, has been killed near %2.
%1, a %3 fighter, has been killed near %2 by friendly fire.
Translation: %1, bojownik %3, został zabity w pobliżu %2 przez przyjazny ogień.

Source: Medium size civilian backpack produced on Nogova. Copy of a US design.
Locked briefcase with unknown, but seemingly very important contents.
Can be used to establish a camp, creating a jump-off point for the resistance. After placing, the camp can be dismantled and the kit may be reused.
Largest backpack from the Batohárna Lipany product line, copy of a US design.
Small tourist backpack, copy of a Soviet design.
Tents can be deployed at camps to enable respawning. They are single use, but can be picked up and moved.
Small personal backpack, a copy of Soviet military design. Produced by Batohárna Lipany n.p. on Nogova.
Soaked in blood. Wearing this will make you suspicious.
%1 uses passphrases to avoid deconspiration, as listed in the schedule below. Make sure to use the correct one when contacting resistance members to authenticate yourself.
Translation: %1 używa pseudonimów, aby uniknąć dekonspiracji, jak wymieniono w poniższym harmonogramie. Używaj poprawnego podczas kontaktowania się z członkami oporu, aby się uwierzytelnić.

Source: %1 changes its operating radio frequency according to the listing below. To establish radio communication with HQ, you must use the correct passphrase while within range of a controlled radio tower.
Translation: %1 zmienia swoją działającą częstotliwość radiową zgodnie z poniższą listą. Aby ustanowić komunikację radiową z siedzibą, musisz użyć prawidłowej frazy, w zakresie w zakresie kontrolowanej wieży radiowej.

Source: The occupier has deployed a SOF group to hunt one of our leaders down. Luckily enough, we have intel on their camping location. Find the camp and eliminate the group.
You have to deliver a very important... whatever. It's not your business. The briefcase is locked anyway. Just don't lose it and bring it in one piece to the recipient.

We need distraction. Engage with the enemy garrison and stay in contact until they launch an alarm. Do not try to capture it, once the alarm goes off you should back off immediately. This will be enough to keep their QRF busy for a moment.
Our intelligence has credible information that captives are currently being held at one of the enemy prisons.
Ensure that none of the captives are killed during the escape, as this would put us in a very bad light.
Your task is to liberate them and escort them to a safe location, out of enemy fire and at a reasonable distance from the prison.
We received information about a high value target being present at one of the enemy locations. Your task is to eliminate the target by any means necessary. Once done, report back to the resistance.
Simple tool that can be used to open locks.
Produces %1 supplies per hour between 8:00 and 16:00 when under control of the resistance.
Translation: Produkuje %1 dostawy na godzinę między 8:00 a 16:00, gdy jest pod kontrolą oporu.

Source: Keep control by maintaining at least %1% population support.
Translation: Zachowaj kontrolę, utrzymując co najmniej % 1 % wsparcia populacji.

Source: Destroy all radars to neutralize the site.
Translation: Zniszcz wszystkie radary, aby zneutralizować stronę.

Source: Take control by raising population support to %1% and keeping the threat level below %2%.
Translation: Przejmij kontrolę, podnosząc wsparcie populacji do %1 %i utrzymując poziom zagrożenia poniżej %2 %.

Source: Start the battle by increasing the threat level to %2% and ensuring at least %1% population support.
Translation: Rozpocznij bitwę, zwiększając poziom zagrożenia do % 2 % i zapewnienie co najmniej % 1 % populacji populacji.

Source: Establish a hideout by raising population support to %1%.
Translation: Ustal kryjówkę, podnosząc wsparcie populacji do %1 %.

Source: Keep population support above %1% to maintain the hideout.
Translation: Utrzymuj populację powyżej % 1 %, aby utrzymać kryjówkę.

Source: The resistance failed to take control over %1.
The resistance failed to take control over %1.
Military radar site near %1 has been destroyed by the resistance.
Translation: Miejsce radaru wojskowego w pobliżu %1 zostało zniszczone przez opór.

Source: The resistance has captured a radio tower near %1.
Translation: Opór uchwycił wieżę radiową w pobliżu %1.

Source: The resistance defended their control over %1.
The resistance failed to take control over %1.
Delivery job failed, the contact person is dead.
Delivery job failed, destination hideout disbanded.
The resistance cleared an enemy camp near %1.
Translation: Opór oczyszczył obóz wroga w pobliżu %1.

Source: The uprising started by %1 has been crushed. %2 remains under %3 control.
Translation: Powstanie rozpoczęte przez %1 zostało zmiażdżone. %2 pozostaje poniżej %3 kontroli.

Source: %1 has won the uprising and took control over %2. Good job!
Translation: %1 wygrał powstanie i przejął kontrolę nad %2. Dobra robota!

Source: A new revolution has started. Rise up, people of %1!
Translation: Rozpoczęła się nowa rewolucja. Wzrost, ludzie o %1!

Source: The resistance hideout in %1 is back in operation.
The resistance hideout in %1 has been shut down.
Translation: Ukrywa się oporu w %1 została zamknięta.

Source: The resistance has established a new hideout in %1.
The resistance HQ near %1 has been shut down due to imminent danger.
Translation: Siedlista oporności w pobliżu %1 została zamknięta z powodu zbliżającego się niebezpieczeństwa.

Source: The resistance has established a new HQ hideout.
The %1 HQ near %2 is shut down due to operator death.
Translation: %1 hq blisko %2 jest wyłączona ze względu na śmierć operatora.

Source: The resistance hideout in %1 is inoperable due to imminent danger.
Translation: Krusza oporowe w %1 jest nieoperacyjne z powodu zbliżającego się niebezpieczeństwa.

Source: The %1 hideout in %2 is shut down due to operator death.
Translation: Kryjówka %1 w %2 jest zamknięta z powodu śmierci operatora.

Source: The resistance failed to free any prisoners in a jailbreak attempt.
%1 has been destroyed by enemy forces.
You receive %1 for completing the job.
Radio tower near %1 has been destroyed.
Translation: Wieża radiowa w pobliżu %1 została zniszczona.

Source: Inventory storage box with reasonable capacity for personal equipment. Can be locked to protect the items.
Translation: Pudełko do przechowywania zapasów z rozsądną pojemnością na sprzęt osobisty. Można zablokować, aby chronić przedmioty.

Source: Placing the flag will establish a new operating base.
Translation: Umieszczenie flagi ustanowi nową bazę operacyjną.

Source: The light can be switched on and off.
Basic building block of a defensive position.
Please wait for the server administrator to configure and start a new game. If you are the administrator, please log in by typing the command below into the chat.
Translation: Poczekaj, aż administrator serwera skonfiguruje i rozpocznij nową grę. Jeśli jesteś administratorem, zaloguj się, wpisując poniższe polecenie na czacie.

Source: We encourage you to check out Field Manual to learn more about this game mode while you are waiting.
Translation: Zachęcamy do sprawdzenia Podręcznika polowa , aby dowiedzieć się więcej o tym trybie gry podczas oczekiwania.

Source: Posters can be hanged in various places to increase civilian population support and increase visibility of the resistance.
Translation: Plakaty można zawiesić w różnych miejscach, aby zwiększyć wsparcie ludności cywilnej i zwiększyć widoczność oporu.

Source: The radio tower has been destroyed and is inoperable.
Translation: Wieża radiowa została zniszczona i jest nieoperacyjna.

Source: Spawning at this camp will consume 1 tent.
You will spawn as a resistance fighter.
Respawning at this location will take %1 supplies.
Translation: Odrastanie w tej lokalizacji zajmie %1 materiałów eksploatacyjnych.

Source: Click on selected location to respawn.
Translation: Kliknij wybraną lokalizację, aby się odrodzić.

Source: Click to respawn at this location.
Translation: Kliknij, aby odrodzić się w tym miejscu.

Source: Respawn will reduce population support by %1.
You will spawn in civilian clothes, with a handgun and a map.
Translation: Będziesz odrodzić się w cywilnych ubraniach z pistoletem i mapą.

Source: This respawn location is not available due to ongoing battle.
Translation: Ta lokalizacja odrodzona nie jest dostępna z powodu trwającej bitwy.

Source: Cannot respawn while enemies are present at this location.
Translation: Nie mogą odrodzić się, gdy wrogowie są obecni w tym miejscu.

Source: This respawn location is not available at the moment.
Translation: Ta lokalizacja odrodzenia nie jest obecnie dostępna.

Source: You need local population support to respawn at this location.
Translation: W tym miejscu potrzebujesz wsparcia lokalnej ludności w tym miejscu.

Source: No tents are available at this camp for respawn.
Spawning here requires at least %1 supplies in storage.
Translation: Trtrarnowanie tutaj wymaga co najmniej %1 materiałów eksploatacyjnych.

Source: This location must be under resistance control to respawn.
Translation: Ta lokalizacja musi być pod kontrolą odporności na odrodzenie.

Source: There are no items in your inventory to sell.
Translation: W twoich zapasach nie ma przedmiotów do sprzedaży.

Source: There are no items available for purchase.
Translation: Nie ma dostępnych przedmiotów do zakupu.

Source: You are a bunch of terrorists. You should be arrested.
Translation: Jesteś grupą terrorystów. Powinieneś zostać aresztowany.

Source: The regime brought order, and you people just want chaos.
Translation: Reżim przyniósł porządek, a wy ludzie po prostu chcecie chaosu.

Source: I hope they find you. I'll be the one pointing the gun.
Translation: Mam nadzieję, że cię znajdą. Będę to jedyny wskazujący na broń.

Source: I stand with the ones who actually protect this place, not you.
Translation: Stoję z tymi, którzy faktycznie chronią to miejsce, a nie ty.

Source: I'll make sure authorities learn about it.
Translation: Upewnię się, że władze się o tym dowiedzą.

Source: That just sounds like another way to die.
Translation: To po prostu brzmi jak inny sposób na śmierć.

Source: Change? That's a fairy tale. I'm just trying to stay alive.
Translation: Zmiana? To bajka. Po prostu staram się pozostać przy życiu.

Source: Get lost. I don't need your cause or your problems.
Translation: Spadaj. Nie potrzebuję twojej przyczyny ani problemów.

Source: I'm not cut out for that kind of thing. Sorry.
Translation: Nie jestem wycięty na tego rodzaju rzeczy. Przepraszam.

Source: I tried once. It didn't end well.
Translation: Próbowałem raz. To się nie skończyło.
Dołącz do ciebie? Nie jestem samobójcą.

Source: Already embedded. I just don't advertise it.
Translation: Już osadzony. Po prostu tego nie reklamuję.

Source: You're not the first to ask. I signed up a while ago.
Translation: Nie jesteś pierwszym, który pytasz. Zapisałem się jakiś czas temu.

Source: You guys seriously need to talk to each other. I'm with you.
Translation: Poważnie musicie ze sobą rozmawiać. Jestem z tobą.

Source: You don't need to convince me. I've bled for this already.
Translation: Nie musisz mnie przekonać. Już za to krwawiłem.

Source: Count me in. It's time someone stood up to them.
Translation: Policz mnie. Nadszedł czas, aby ktoś się do nich wstał.

Source: Tell your people I'm ready. Let's get to work.
Translation: Powiedz swoim ludziom, że jestem gotowy. Zabierzmy się do pracy.

Source: I'm in. Just tell me what needs to be done.
Translation: Jestem w środku. Po prostu powiedz mi, co należy zrobić.

Source: Hell yeah. Let's mess them up.
That supposed to scare me? Try harder.
Translation: To powinno mnie przestraszyć? Spróbuj mocniej.

Source: I've got nothing for you, except regret.
Translation: Nie mam nic dla ciebie, oprócz żalu.

Source: Get lost, I'm not scared of you.
Translation: Zgub się, nie boję się cię.

Source: You're not the first to try.
Alright, alright! Just don't hurt me!
Translation: W porządku, dobrze! Po prostu mnie nie skrzywdzaj!
Proszę… po prostu zostaw mnie w spokoju.

Source: It was for my kid's medicine... but whatever. Take it.
Translation: To było dla medycyny mojego dziecka… ale cokolwiek. Weź to.

Source: You are worse than the regime.
Fine, but you just lost a supporter.
Translation: W porządku, ale właśnie straciłeś kibica.

Source: I'm sure the resistance will pay back for this.
Translation: Jestem pewien, że opór się za to zwróci.

Source: You are just bandits in uniforms.
Wear some pants before you talk to me.
I'm not talking to naked strangers.
I have nothing to say to you.
Do you have something for me?
You look like someone who's had enough. Join us.
Translation: Wyglądasz jak ktoś, kto ma dość. Dołącz do nas.

Source: I have enough of these pigs. Are you in, or are you just surviving?
Translation: Mam dość tych świń. Jesteś w środku, czy po prostu przeżywasz?

Source: If you're tired of hiding, pick up a cause worth dying for.
Translation: Jeśli masz dość ukrywania się, wybierz przyczynę, na którą warto umrzeć.

Source: Not everyone's blind to what's going on. Some of us are doing something about it.
Translation: Nie wszyscy są ślepi na to, co się dzieje. Niektórzy z nas coś z tym robią.

Source: Are you willing to make a difference? Because we are.
Translation: Czy chcesz coś zmienić? Ponieważ jesteśmy.

Source: We've got fire, we've got purpose - all we're missing is you.
Translation: Mamy ogień, mamy cel - wszystko, czego nam brakuje, to ty.

Source: You want change? You don't get it by sitting around. Join us.
Translation: Chcesz zmienić? Nie rozumiesz tego, siedząc. Dołącz do nas.

Source: You sick of their boot on your neck? Then maybe it's time to push back.
Translation: Masz dość ich butów na szyi? Może nadszedł czas, aby się odepchnąć.

Source: Orders? We make our own now. Join us.
Translation: Święcenia? Teraz tworzymy własne. Dołącz do nas.

Source: There's a war coming whether you're ready or not. Best be on the right side.
Translation: Nadchodzi wojna, niezależnie od tego, czy jesteś gotowy, czy nie. Najlepiej być po prawej stronie.

Source: I'm not asking twice. Money, now.
Translation: Nie pytam dwa razy. Pieniądze, teraz.

Source: You pay now, or you bleed later. Simple math.
Translation: Płacisz teraz lub krwawiłeś później. Prosta matematyka.

Source: Protection doesn't come free. Give me your money.
Translation: Ochrona nie jest wolna. Daj mi swoje pieniądze.

Source: This is the part where you give me what I want.
Translation: To jest część, w której dajesz mi to, czego chcę.

Source: Last guy who said no is still chewing through a straw.
Translation: Ostatni facet, który powiedział nie, wciąż przeżywa słomkę.

Source: I'm ready to do whatever it takes to help our cause.
Translation: Jestem gotowy zrobić wszystko, aby pomóc naszej sprawie.

Source: Hey, we talked earlier. I want to join the fight.
Translation: Hej, rozmawialiśmy wcześniej. Chcę dołączyć do walki.

Source: I have to pass this one to someone else.
This is not a job for me.
Get out of here, you are free.
I am getting you out of here.
Got any more of those posters?
There are people with guns, we're scared, can you send a patrol over here?
Translation: Są ludzie z bronią, boimy się, czy możesz wysłać tutaj patrol?

Source: More enemies are eating dirt. Here's proof.
Translation: Więcej wrogów je brud. Oto dowód.

Source: So, you want to take it to the next level?
Translation: Więc chcesz przenieść go na wyższy poziom?

Source: We are running an... um... incentive scheme of sorts.
Certain friends of our cause are offering money for every eliminated enemy soldier.
Translation: Niektórzy przyjaciele naszej sprawy oferują pieniądze dla każdego wyeliminowanego wroga żołnierza.

Source: They don't buy our word, but enemy dogtags are solid proof.
Translation: Nie kupują naszego słowa, ale Dogtagi wroga są solidnym dowodem.

Source: Bring me a handful of those if you're not joking around.
Translation: Przynieś mi garść z nich, jeśli nie żartujesz.

Source: Your next task is to set up a field operating base.
Translation: Kolejnym zadaniem jest skonfigurowanie bazy operacyjnej.

Source: Pick a good spot for it. You can use your map to check which areas are too dangerous.
Translation: Wybierz do tego dobre miejsce. Możesz użyć mapy, aby sprawdzić, które obszary są zbyt niebezpieczne.

Source: You'll need some money to kick it off. Oh, and don't forget a shovel.
Translation: Potrzebujesz trochę pieniędzy, aby je rozpocząć. Aha, i nie zapomnij łopaty.

Source: Make sure you are not followed.
Translation: Upewnij się, że nie jesteś śledzony.

Source: Very well then. But we need more people before we take up arms. Actually, there is something you can do for us.
Translation: W takim razie bardzo dobrze. Ale potrzebujemy więcej ludzi, zanim weźmiemy broń. Właściwie jest coś, co możesz dla nas zrobić.

Source: Take this briefcase. I need you to deliver it to someone. Don't look inside.
You're calling just in time. Grab instructions from the dead drop at coordinates:
Translation: Dzwonisz w samą porę. Chwyć instrukcje z martwego kropli na współrzędne:

Source: Yes. Come visit me for further instructions.
Translation: Tak. Odwiedź mnie, aby uzyskać dalsze instrukcje.

Source: I'm glad you came. Take this note with instructions.
Translation: Cieszę się, że przyszedłeś. Weź tę notatkę z instrukcjami.

Source: Well done. I wish we had more like you in our ranks.
Translation: Dobrze zrobiony. Żałuję, że nie mieliśmy bardziej jak ty w naszych szeregach.

Source: Report back to me in person after the job is done.
Translation: Zgłoś mi osobiście po wykonaniu pracy.

Source: Shame, I thought you were capable.
Think twice before you waste my time again.
I am not around. Reach me out when things get calmer.
Translation: Nie ma mnie w pobliżu. Skontaktuj się ze mną, gdy wszystko się uspokoi.

Source: Not right now, but check back later.
We have to spread the word. Visit nearby towns and hang a bunch of revolutionary posters.
Translation: Musimy rozpowszechniać to słowo. Odwiedź pobliskie miasta i zawiesić kilka rewolucyjnych plakatów.

Source: Look for cabinets, advertisement boards, signs and other things that attract attention.
Translation: Poszukaj szaf, tablic reklamowych, znaków i innych rzeczy, które przyciągają uwagę.

Source: This is illegal, make sure you are not seen putting these up, or at least don't get yourself killed.
Translation: Jest to nielegalne, upewnij się, że nie widać ich, a przynajmniej nie zginaj się.

Source: You already have enough posters with you. It's too dangerous to carry more.
Translation: Masz już wystarczającą ilość plakatów z tobą. To zbyt niebezpieczne, aby nosić więcej.

Source: I don't have any more left at the moment.
Translation: W tej chwili nie mam już więcej.

Source: Make some space in your bag if you want the posters.
Translation: Zrób trochę miejsca w torbie, jeśli chcesz plakaty.

Source: I was expecting you. Thanks for the delivery.
You've reached the Military Police post. How can I help you?
Translation: Dotarłeś do stanowiska policji wojskowej. Czy mogę Panu pomóc?

Source: Hang tight, we will dispatch someone your way immediately.
Translation: Trzymaj się mocno, natychmiast wyślemy kogoś na twoją drogę.

Source: This vehicle type cannot be repaired at this support station.
Translation: Tego rodzaju pojazdu nie można naprawić na tej stacji wsparcia.

Source: Curfew is in effect from %1 to %2.
